newsitem.title: USA: Spacetec IMC sees Q3 operating net loss.
newsitem.headline: Spacetec IMC sees Q3 operating net loss.

text.p: Spacetec IMC Corp said on Monday it expected a third-quarter operating net loss because of costs of operating a retail sales channel.
The company was not immediately available to say whether its results would reflect a charge in the third quarter ended December 31.

In a statement, the company said third-quarter revenues failed to meet management expectations because of disappointing retail sales of the new SpaceOrb 360 over the pre-Christmas and holiday-selling season.
"Opening and maintaining the retail sales channel has been very costly so the company is expecting a significant operating net loss for the quarter," said Chief Financial Officer Neil Rossen.

"The loss for the quarter is unlikely to significantly exceed market expectations and ... we expect to sharply reduce our loss in the fourth quarter despite lowered expectations for the SpaceOrb 360," he said.
Spacetec reported third-quarter earnings per share last year of $0.03 on income of $178,000. Revenues totaled $2 million.
The company specializes in devices that aid in rotating three-dimensional models on computer screens.
